hypothesis_content.title: BTC Extreme RSI Reversal After News-Driven Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a sharp price spike (+5% within 2 hours) coinciding with major positive news headlines (e.g., treasury buys, ETF inflows), followed by RSI(4h) exceeding 85, a mean reversion short entry will be profitable within 24-48 hours as retail FOMO exhausts.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven spikes in neutral/bull regimes often attract late retail buying near tops. Extreme short-term RSI combined with positive funding indicates crowded long positioning. The 'BitMine bought 4M ETH' type news creates emotional buying that typically fades.
entry_conditions: Major positive BTC/ETH news headline within preceding 4 hours (verified via news sentiment API score > 0.7)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 2-hour spike move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price exceeds the high of the initial spike candle by 0.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >60% of such setups continue trending upward beyond the spike high (stop loss hit) instead of mean reverting, over 50 occurrences.
